Title: Development of gamification mobile application for students
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sanjaya, L.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Titan, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Learning activities, especially in universities that are accepted by students, become critical aspects. The development of students in the current generation who have entered generations Y and Z will undoubtedly affect the university's learning process. The learning process that is not interesting will cause students not to get maximum knowledge. Gamification in the learning process at a university is one method that can be applied so that the learning process becomes more exciting and useful. Triggered by these needs, this research focuses on developing mobile applications based on gamification. The application will feature Create Quiz, Create Interactive Study Case, Create Badge, Create Rank, View Scoreboard, Video-based forums, and View Achievement Report to increase knowledge and interest learning. System Development Life Cycle was the primary method to develop this mobile application. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Gamification learning system; Interactive learning; Students learning system
Index Keywords: Gamification; Information management; Life cycle; Mobile computing; Students; Current generation; Learning Activity; Learning process; Mobile applications; Research focus; Study case; System development life cycles; Learning systems

Authors: Titan, Ferdianto, Sanjaya L.S., Prasandy T.
Title: Application Design of Students' Learning Outcomes Completion in BINUS Online Learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Titan, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sanjaya, L.S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prasandy, T., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Based on PERMENDIKBUD No. 109 in Year 2013 which concerned about implementation of Distance Education, Indonesian Government had been encouraged the educational institution in Indonesia to organize the online learning program. The growth of online learning program faces issue and challenge in assuring the completion of students' learning outcomes. The completion of them will represent the effectiveness of the learning process in online environment, so that it can gain trust from the public in terms of quality of education. For accommodating this need, the research has been conducted in order to propose an application design for measuring the completion of students' learning outcomes in online learning environment. Design application will follow the methodology of system development life cycle (SDLC) with waterfall approach. The design of functional, data, and user interface will be the output of this research. It should also be concerned that every questions in assessment must be related to the learning outcomes, so they could be stored and used as a basis for learning outcomes completion report. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: application design; learning outcomes; learning outcomes completion; online learning

Title: Design of Student's Learning Outcomes Measurement System in BINUS Online Learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sanjaya, L.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Titan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The rapid growth of online learning in Indonesia is supported by PERMENDIKBUD No. 109 year 2013 about implementation of Distance Education (Pendidikan Jarak Jauh/ P JJ), triggering the educational institution to organize the program. This online learning environment has its own challenge that is to measure learning outcomes of students especially because the learning is done online. Therefore, the measurement of effectiveness needs to be done to ensure the learning process through online media can still gain trust from the public in terms of quality of education. Research methods that will be used for data collection are literature review and interview to the faculty. System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) with waterfall approach will also be used as a guideline in system design. From this research, it is founded that the measurement from learning outcomes from several assessments can be done. This finding will help educational institutions, especially BINUS Online Learning in developing monitoring and measurement model and system of student learning outcomes associated with teaching and learning process itself. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: A comparative study of teaching styles in online learning environment
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Titan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Desak, G.G.F.P., Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lena, Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Because of its flexibility, nowadays online learning serves as a promising alternative for busy people in continuing their educations. This alternative offers you online learning interactions through synchronous and asynchronous session, which usually accommodated by learning management systems or another technology platform and applications. Basically, in online learning environment, the learning interaction will have a transition from teacher-dependent to learner-dependent, but it still can't be concluded that the succession in online learning doesn't affected by the teaching styles of the instructor. This study is aimed to see whether the teaching styles of the instructors will have an impact in academic achievement of the students. The study was conducted by a comparative study towards two classes with two different instructors, which have their own teaching styles. The result said that the class with the more active and responsive instructors has a better results in score. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Mobile application business plan to assist travel planning
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sanjaya, L.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Titan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Johan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The mobile application business plan was intended to solve the problem often faced by travelers in planning their trip. This business plan includes development of the business model, mobile application with proposed features, and also its financial sustainability plan. In this paper, the authors use methods such as Business Model Canvas, Five Forces Analysis by Porter, and Financial Analysis include Return of Investment (RoI), Internal Rate of Return (IRR), and Payback Period. The mobile application will complement the business plan with the proposed features such as trip suggestion and other supporting features (hotel, restaurant, tour spot, news, and tourism event). © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Business; Mobile Application; Planning; Tourism; Travel
Index Keywords: Earnings; Industry; Information management; Investments; Planning; Business modeling; Financial analysis; Financial sustainability; Internal rate of return; Mobile applications; Return of investments; Tourism; Travel; Mobile computing

Title: Influential factors on travel decision in e-tourism
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Titan, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sanjaya, L.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ferdianto, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: One of the technology utilization in tourism industry is doing the online promotion through website and social media. Many organizations, from government or private institution, build their own e-tourism, so that the tourists can get enough information to realize their plan for a holiday trip. The aim of this study is to adduce factors of e-tourism that have significance influences in affecting tourist's travel decision. This study used questionnaire as tool in the data collection, which was distributed to the frequent tourists, having minimum three (3) holiday trips a year. 200 questionnaires are used as the basis of data analysis. Correlation bivariate is conducted for the hypotheses testing. The results express that purchasing decision were significantly influenced by opinions & perception target, advice of travel agent, information obtained from destinations, e-commerce feature, access time, possibility of comparison, and social media. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: e-Tourism; e-Tourism factors; travel decision; traveling decision
Index Keywords: Information management; Social networking (online); eTourism; Hypotheses testing; Influential factors; Private institutions; Purchasing decisions; Technology utilization; Travel decisions; traveling decision; Surveys
